result.translation: Tā sīn mīm.[1]
result.footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.

result.translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.

result.arabic_text: لَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٞ نَّفۡسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Perhaps you[2] will grieve yourself to death because they do not believe.
result.footnotes: [2] O Muhammad.

result.arabic_text: إِن نَّشَأۡ نُنَزِّلۡ عَلَيۡهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةٗ فَظَلَّتۡ أَعۡنَٰقُهُمۡ لَهَا خَٰضِعِينَ
result.translation: If We willed, We could send down upon them a sign from the heaven, at which their necks would stay bowed in humility[3].
result.footnotes: [3] i.e., they would be compelled to believe, being humbled.

result.arabic_text: وَمَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن ذِكۡرٖ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مُحۡدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ عَنۡهُ مُعۡرِضِينَ
result.translation: No new reminder comes to them from the Most Compassionate except that they turn away from it.

result.arabic_text: فَقَدۡ كَذَّبُواْ فَسَيَأۡتِيهِمۡ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُاْ مَا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
result.translation: They have rejected [the Truth], soon there will come to them the consequences of their ridicule.

result.arabic_text: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَمۡ أَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوۡجٖ كَرِيمٍ
result.translation: Do they not see the earth, how many fine kinds of plants We grow in it?

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them will not believe.
Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

result.arabic_text: وَإِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئۡتِ ٱلۡقَوۡمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
result.translation: And [remember] when your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the wrongdoing people –
the people of Pharaoh; will they not fear [the punishment of] Allah?”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
result.translation: He said, “My Lord, I fear that they may reject me,

result.arabic_text: وَيَضِيقُ صَدۡرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرۡسِلۡ إِلَىٰ هَٰرُونَ
result.translation: and I will feel distressed and my tongue will not be fluent, so send Aaron along [to help me].

result.arabic_text: وَلَهُمۡ عَلَيَّ ذَنۢبٞ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقۡتُلُونِ
result.translation: Moreover, they have a charge against me, so I fear they may kill me[4].”
result.footnotes: [4] For killing a Coptic Egyptian by mistake before becoming a prophet.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ كَلَّاۖ فَٱذۡهَبَا بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسۡتَمِعُونَ
result.translation: Allah said, “Certainly not! Go, both of you, with Our signs[5]; We are with you, listening.
result.footnotes: [5] i.e., the miracles of the staff and the shining hand, given to Moses.

result.arabic_text: فَأۡتِيَا فِرۡعَوۡنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
result.translation: Go to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are the messengers[6] from the Lord of the worlds,
result.footnotes: [6] The singular form in Arabic denotes that they both were sent with a single message.

result.translation: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.’”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ أَلَمۡ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدٗا وَلَبِثۡتَ فِينَا مِنۡ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
result.translation: Pharaoh said, “Did we not bring you up as a child among us, and you stayed with us several years of your life?

result.arabic_text: وَفَعَلۡتَ فَعۡلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِي فَعَلۡتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
result.translation: Yet you did what you did[7], and you are extremely ungrateful.”
result.footnotes: [7] i.e., striking the Copt in support of a man from your people, who died as a result.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ فَعَلۡتُهَآ إِذٗا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
result.translation: He said, “I did it when I had no guidance.

result.arabic_text: فَفَرَرۡتُ مِنكُمۡ لَمَّا خِفۡتُكُمۡ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكۡمٗا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ
result.translation: So I fled from you in fear. Then my Lord gave me wisdom and made me one of the messengers.

result.arabic_text: وَتِلۡكَ نِعۡمَةٞ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنۡ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
result.translation: Is this a favor that you remind me with, that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?[8]
result.footnotes: [8] i.e., If you had not been cruel to the Israelites, I should not have been brought to your house for upbringing.

result.translation: Pharaoh said, “What is ‘the Lord of the worlds’?”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
result.translation: Moses said, “The Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, if only you had sure faith.”
Pharaoh said to those around him, “Did you hear [what he just said]?”
Moses said, “Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِيٓ أُرۡسِلَ إِلَيۡكُمۡ لَمَجۡنُونٞ
result.translation: Pharaoh said, “Your messenger who has been sent to you is truly insane!”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ
result.translation: Moses said, “Lord of the east and west and all that is between them, if only you had sense!”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذۡتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيۡرِي لَأَجۡعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمَسۡجُونِينَ
result.translation: Pharaoh said, “If you take any god other than me, I will throw you into prison.”
Moses said, “What if I bring you a clear proof?”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ فَأۡتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
result.translation: Pharaoh said, “Bring it then if you are truthful!”

result.arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعۡبَانٞ مُّبِينٞ
result.translation: So he threw down his staff, and suddenly it was a real serpent.

result.arabic_text: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيۡضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ
result.translation: And he drew out his hand, and it was glowing white to the beholders.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ لِلۡمَلَإِ حَوۡلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٞ
result.translation: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, “This is indeed a learned magician!

result.arabic_text: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنۡ أَرۡضِكُم بِسِحۡرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأۡمُرُونَ
result.translation: He wants to drive you out of your land with his magic. What do you suggest?”

result.arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ أَرۡجِهۡ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبۡعَثۡ فِي ٱلۡمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ
result.translation: They said, “Let him and his brother wait and dispatch heralds to the cities
to bring you every learned magician.”
So the magicians were assembled at an appointed time on a known day[9].
result.footnotes: [9] i.e., the morning of the festival day. See 20:58-59.

result.translation: And it was said to the people, “Will you join the gathering,

result.arabic_text: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ
result.translation: so that we may follow the magicians, if they are victorious?”

result.arabic_text: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُواْ لِفِرۡعَوۡنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجۡرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ
result.translation: When the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, “Will there be a reward for us if we are victorious?”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ نَعَمۡ وَإِنَّكُمۡ إِذٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ
result.translation: He said, “Yes, and then you will surely be of those who are close to me.”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلۡقُواْ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلۡقُونَ
result.translation: Moses said to them, “Throw whatever you wish to throw.”

result.arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَوۡاْ حِبَالَهُمۡ وَعِصِيَّهُمۡ وَقَالُواْ بِعِزَّةِ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ
result.translation: So they threw their ropes and staffs, and said, “By the glory of Pharaoh, it is we who will be the victorious!”

result.arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلۡقَفُ مَا يَأۡفِكُونَ
result.translation: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it swallowed up all objects of their illusion.
So the magicians fell down in prostration.
They said, “We believe in the Lord of the worlds,
the Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ قَبۡلَ أَنۡ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمۡۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحۡرَ فَلَسَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيۡدِيَكُمۡ وَأَرۡجُلَكُم مِّنۡ خِلَٰفٖ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
result.translation: Pharaoh said, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission. Indeed, he is your master who taught you magic, but you will soon come to know. I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, then I will crucify you all.”

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَا ضَيۡرَۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
result.translation: They said, “No harm; we will surely return to our Lord.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّا نَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَٰيَٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers.”

result.arabic_text: ۞ وَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنۡ أَسۡرِ بِعِبَادِيٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
result.translation: We inspired Moses, “Leave with My slaves by night; you will surely be pursued.”
So Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities[10],
result.footnotes: [10] In order to prevent the emigration of the Children of Israel.

result.translation: saying, “These are but a small band,
and they have enraged us,
but we are all well-prepared.”
Thus did We drive them[11] out of their gardens and springs,
result.footnotes: [11] i.e., Pharaoh and his people.

result.translation: and their treasures and splendid dwellings.
So it was, and We made the Children of Israel to inherit them.
They pursued them at sunrise.

result.arabic_text: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلۡجَمۡعَانِ قَالَ أَصۡحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدۡرَكُونَ
result.translation: When the two groups saw each other, the companions of Moses said, “We are surely overtaken!”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ كَلَّآۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ
result.translation: Moses said, “Certainly not! My Lord is with me; He will guide me.”

result.arabic_text: فَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضۡرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرۡقٖ كَٱلطَّوۡدِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
result.translation: Then We inspired Moses, “Strike the sea with your staff,” so it parted, and each part became like a huge mountain.
Then We brought the others [i.e., the pursuers] close to that place,
and We saved Moses and all those who were with him.
Then we drowned the others.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
Relate to them the story of Abraham,

result.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
result.translation: when he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?”

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ نَعۡبُدُ أَصۡنَامٗا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ
result.translation: They said, “We worship idols and remain devoted to them.”
He said, “Do they hear you when you call upon them?
Or can they benefit or harm you?”

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ بَلۡ وَجَدۡنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفۡعَلُونَ
result.translation: They said, “No, but this is what we found our forefathers doing.”
He said, “Do you see what you have been worshiping,
you and your ancestors?

result.arabic_text: فَإِنَّهُمۡ عَدُوّٞ لِّيٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
result.translation: Indeed, they are my enemies, except the Lord of the worlds[12],
result.footnotes: [12] As they worshiped idols in addition to worshiping Allah.

result.translation: Who created me, so He guides me;
and it is He Who provides me with food and drink;
and when I am ill He heals me;
and He will cause me to die and then bring me back to life;

result.arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لِي خَطِيٓـَٔتِي يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ
result.translation: and I hope that He will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgment.”

result.arabic_text: رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي حُكۡمٗا وَأَلۡحِقۡنِي بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
result.translation: “My Lord, grant me knowledge, and join me with the righteous,

result.arabic_text: وَٱجۡعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدۡقٖ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
result.translation: and grant me an honorable mention among the later generations[13],
result.footnotes: [13] Muslims invoke Allah’s blessings upon Abraham (ﷺ) along with Muhammad (ﷺ) in their daily prayers.

result.translation: and make me of those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss;

result.arabic_text: وَٱغۡفِرۡ لِأَبِيٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
result.translation: and forgive my father, for he is one of those who have gone astray;
and do not disgrace me on the Day when all will be resurrected –

result.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٞ وَلَا بَنُونَ
result.translation: the Day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail,

result.arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنۡ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلۡبٖ سَلِيمٖ
result.translation: except the one who comes to Allah with a sound heart[14].”
result.footnotes: [14] A heart free from disbelief, polytheism, hypocrisy, arrogance, and show-off.

result.translation: Paradise will be brought near to the righteous,
and Hellfire will be uncovered to those who went astray,

result.arabic_text: وَقِيلَ لَهُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡبُدُونَ
result.translation: and they will be told, “Where are those whom you used to worship

result.arabic_text: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلۡ يَنصُرُونَكُمۡ أَوۡ يَنتَصِرُونَ
result.translation: other than Allah? Can they help you or even help themselves?”
Then they will be hurled into Hell one upon another, along with those who led them astray,
and the followers of Iblīs, all together.
There the deviants will say while quarreling with their false deities,

result.arabic_text: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ
result.translation: “By Allah, we were clearly misguided,
when we deemed you equal to the Lord of the worlds.
None led us astray except the wicked.
Now we neither have any intercessors,
nor a close friend.

result.arabic_text: فَلَوۡ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةٗ فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: If only we had a chance to return, we would be among the believers.”

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
Your Lord is surely the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of Noah rejected the messengers[15]
result.footnotes: [15] For denying Noah was equal to denying all of the messengers of Allah.

result.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
result.translation: when their brother Noah said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?
I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.

result.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
result.translation: I seek of you no reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds;
so fear Allah, and obey me.”
They said, “Shall we believe in you when you are followed by the lowest people[16]?”
result.footnotes: [16] For they were mostly the poor and ordinary people, who enjoyed no position in society.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ وَمَا عِلۡمِي بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ
result.translation: He said, “What knowledge do I have of what they do?

result.arabic_text: إِنۡ حِسَابُهُمۡ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّيۖ لَوۡ تَشۡعُرُونَ
result.translation: Their reckoning is only with my Lord if you realize!
I am not going to drive the believers away.
I am only a clear warner.”

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمَرۡجُومِينَ
result.translation: They said, “O Noah, if you do not desist, you will certainly be stoned.”
He said, “My Lord, my people have rejected me.

result.arabic_text: فَٱفۡتَحۡ بَيۡنِي وَبَيۡنَهُمۡ فَتۡحٗا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: So judge between me and them decisively, and save me and the believers who are with me.”

result.arabic_text: فَأَنجَيۡنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ
result.translation: So We saved him and those who were with him in the fully laden Ark.
Then We drowned thereafter all the rest.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of ‘Ād rejected the messengers

result.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
result.translation: when their brother Hūd said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.

result.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
result.translation: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
Do you build a landmark[17] on every high place for no purpose?
result.footnotes: [17] They used to build lofty structures along the road to be seen by passersby, as a symbol of their wealth and power.

result.translation: And do you construct for yourselves palaces, hoping that you will live forever?
And when you attack [others], do you attack ruthlessly?
So fear Allah, and obey me.
And fear the One Who has provided you with everything you know:
Who provided you with livestock and children,
and with gardens and springs.

result.arabic_text: إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ
result.translation: I fear for you the punishment of a momentous day.”

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡنَآ أَوَعَظۡتَ أَمۡ لَمۡ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلۡوَٰعِظِينَ
result.translation: They said, “It is the same to us whether you admonish us or not.
This is nothing but the custom of the former people,
and we will never be punished.”

result.arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهۡلَكۡنَٰهُمۡۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Thus they rejected him, so We destroyed them. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe,
Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of Thamūd rejected the messengers

result.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ صَٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
result.translation: when their brother Sālih said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.

result.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
result.translation: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
Will you be left secure in whatever you have here,
in gardens and springs,
and in fields of crops and date palms laden with tender fruit,
carving out houses in the mountains with great skill?
So fear Allah, and obey me.
And do not obey the command of the transgressors,

result.arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفۡسِدُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا يُصۡلِحُونَ
result.translation: those who spread corruption in the land and never do what is right.”
They said, “You are but one of those who are bewitched!

result.arabic_text: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا فَأۡتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
result.translation: You are but a human like us, so bring a sign if you are one of the truthful.”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٞ لَّهَا شِرۡبٞ وَلَكُمۡ شِرۡبُ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
result.translation: Sālih said, “This is a she-camel[18]; she will have her share of water and you will have yours, each on a specified day.
result.footnotes: [18] That was miraculously sent to them as a sign by Allah.

result.arabic_text: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٖ فَيَأۡخُذَكُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ
result.translation: Do not touch her with harm, or you will be seized by the punishment of a horrible day.”
But they hamstrung her, then they became regretful,

result.arabic_text: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: So the punishment seized them[19]. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
result.footnotes: [19] They were destroyed by a violent earthquake and a blast after Sālih told them: “You have only three days to enjoy yourselves in your houses”. See 11:65. Allah says: “We sent against them a single blast, leaving them like trampled hedge-building twigs”. See 54:31.

result.translation: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of Lot rejected the messengers,

result.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
result.translation: when their brother Lot said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.

result.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
result.translation: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
Do you approach males with lust among all people[20],
result.footnotes: [20] i.e., Are there any creatures besides you who commit this abominable act?

result.arabic_text: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمۡ رَبُّكُم مِّنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِكُمۚ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٌ عَادُونَ
result.translation: leaving the wives whom your Lord has created for you? You are but a transgressing people.”

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡرَجِينَ
result.translation: They said, “O Lot, If you do not desist, you will surely be expelled.”
Lot said, “I am one of those who utterly abhor your practice.
My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequences of] what they do.”
So We saved him and all his family,
except an old woman who was among those who remained behind[21].
result.footnotes: [21] Lot's wife, who betrayed him by not believing and remained a disbeliever; thus, she was among those destroyed.

result.translation: Then We destroyed the rest,

result.arabic_text: وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم مَّطَرٗاۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ
result.translation: and We poured down upon them a rain [of stones]. How terrible was the rain of those who were warned!

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of the Forest[22] rejected the messengers.
result.footnotes: [22] i.e., the people of Madyan, to whom Shu‘ayb was sent.

result.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ شُعَيۡبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
result.translation: When Shu‘ayb said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.

result.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
result.translation: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.

result.arabic_text: ۞ أَوۡفُواْ ٱلۡكَيۡلَ وَلَا تَكُونُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡسِرِينَ
result.translation: Give full measure and do not be of those who defraud others,
and weigh with accurate scales,

result.arabic_text: وَلَا تَبۡخَسُواْ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشۡيَآءَهُمۡ وَلَا تَعۡثَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُفۡسِدِينَ
result.translation: and do not defraud people of their goods, nor go about in the land spreading corruption.
And fear the One Who created you and the former peoples[23].”
result.footnotes: [23] i.e., generations of the past.

result.translation: They said, “You are truly bewitched!

result.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ
result.translation: You are only a human being like us, and we think you are nothing but a liar.

result.arabic_text: فَأَسۡقِطۡ عَلَيۡنَا كِسَفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
result.translation: So cause pieces of the sky to fall upon us, if you are of the truthful.”
Shu‘ayb said, “My Lord knows best whatever you do.”

result.arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٍ
result.translation: Thus they rejected him, so they were seized by the punishment of the cloudy day; it was the punishment of a horrible day.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
This is indeed a revelation from the Lord of the worlds,
which the Trustworthy Spirit [Gabriel] has brought down
to your heart [O Prophet] so that you may be one of the warners,
in a clear Arabic language.
And it was indeed [mentioned] in the scriptures of the former peoples.

result.arabic_text: أَوَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُمۡ ءَايَةً أَن يَعۡلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَٰٓؤُاْ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
result.translation: Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of the Children of Israel recognized it [to be true][24]?
result.footnotes: [24] e.g., Abdullah ibn Salām, a Jewish scholar, accepted Islam during the lifetime of the Prophet (ﷺ), for he knew that he came with a true message.

result.translation: If We had sent it down to any of the non-Arabs,

result.arabic_text: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيۡهِم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: and he had recited it to them[25]; still, they would not have believed in it.
result.footnotes: [25] As a miracle from Allah.

result.translation: This is how We made it [i.e., disbelief] enter the hearts of the wicked.

result.arabic_text: لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
result.translation: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment,
which will come upon them suddenly when they least expect it.
They will then say, “Can we be granted some respite?”
Do they really seek to hasten Our punishment?
Tell me [O Prophet] if We give them a life of ease for years,
then there came to them what they were warned of,

result.arabic_text: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يُمَتَّعُونَ
result.translation: what would avail them the life of ease that they were given?

result.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
result.translation: We never destroyed any town without sending them warners,
to admonish them, for We are never unjust.
This [Qur’an] is not sent down by the devils[26],
result.footnotes: [26] As the disbelievers claim; rather, it is brought down by Gabriel, the Trustworthy Spirit.

result.translation: it is not for them to do this, nor is it within their capability,
for they are strictly barred from overhearing it[27].
result.footnotes: [27] So they cannot eavesdrop on heaven. See 72:9.

result.arabic_text: فَلَا تَدۡعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُعَذَّبِينَ
result.translation: So do not call upon any other god besides Allah, lest you become of those who will be punished.
And warn [starting with] the nearest kinsfolk,

result.arabic_text: وَٱخۡفِضۡ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: and lower your wing [in kindness] to the believers who follow you.

result.arabic_text: فَإِنۡ عَصَوۡكَ فَقُلۡ إِنِّي بَرِيٓءٞ مِّمَّا تَعۡمَلُونَ
result.translation: But if they disobey you, say, “I disown what you do.”
And put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful,
Who sees you when you stand up [for prayer],
and your movements among those who prostrate.
Indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

result.arabic_text: هَلۡ أُنَبِّئُكُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ
result.translation: Shall I inform you upon who the devils descend?
They descend upon every sinful liar,
who whisper hearsay in the ears, but most of them are liars.
As for poets, they are followed by the deviants.

result.arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّهُمۡ فِي كُلِّ وَادٖ يَهِيمُونَ
result.translation: Do you not see that they wander aimlessly in every valley[28],
result.footnotes: [28] Telling lies indiscriminately, praising some, and disparaging others.

result.translation: and that they say what they do not do?

result.arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَذَكَرُواْ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرٗا وَٱنتَصَرُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا ظُلِمُواْۗ وَسَيَعۡلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٖ يَنقَلِبُونَ
result.translation: Except those who believe, do righteous deeds, remember Allah much and defend themselves[29] after being wronged. The wrongdoers will come to know what end awaits them.
result.footnotes: [29] By replying to the satire of hostile poets through poetry.
